content: Hello, welcome! It's great to have you here. What would you like to talk about today?

Well, I guess I’m here because my partner pushed me to come. Honestly, I've been having a hard time sleeping because work has been so stressful. I’m constantly worried I’ll lose my job, and it’s been eating me up inside. I just don’t know how to stop my mind from racing at night.

That sounds really tough, feeling so stressed about work and struggling to find rest at night. It seems like this has really been weighing on you. Would you like to share a bit more about what’s been making work so stressful for you?

Sure. So, the main thing is the constant uncertainty. The stock market has been rough, and I’m worried that if layoffs happen, I'll probably be one of the first to go. It’s really hard to focus when I feel like my job is constantly on the line.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot of weight, constantly feeling like your job might slip away, and it’s making it hard to concentrate. That uncertainty must feel overwhelming at times. How has all of this been affecting you outside of work?

To be honest, it’s been pretty hard. I feel like I’m always on edge, and it’s seeping into my time with my family. I want to be present for my partner and kids, but I’m just so drained and distracted all the time. It makes me feel guilty, like I’m letting them down.

It sounds like you're feeling stretched really thin, trying to balance your worries about work with being there for your family. It seems important to you to be present for them, but the stress is making that really challenging right now. How do you want things to be different?

I just want to feel like myself again—I want to go to work without that constant voice in my head telling me I’m not good enough, and I want to come home and actually enjoy the time I have with my partner and kids. I feel like I’m missing out on moments I won’t get back, and I hate that. I just want to be able to breathe again, you know?

Wanting to feel like yourself again and enjoy those moments with your family really speaks to how much you value them and your own well-being. It sounds like you’re yearning for peace and presence in your life. What do you think might help you start to feel a bit more like yourself again?
